definition[0]: to become quicker or make something quicker
example[0]: Ray glanced at his watch and quickened his pace  (=began to walk faster).
example[1]: Companies are finding it hard to cope with the quickening pace of technological change.
example[2]: She caught sight of Rob and felt her heart quicken.
definition[1]: if a feeling quickens, or if something quickens it, it becomes stronger or more active
example[3]: This policy served only to quicken anti-government feeling.
